intro: Dicliptera debilis, commonly known as the slender dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
